posts.com:
/r9k/ is an imageboard where there are no exact reposts.

1. If you attempt to post something unoriginal, it is not posted, and you are muted temporarily.
2. The time with which you are muted for doubles with each transgression.
3. Each mute time is 2^n in seconds where n is the number of times you have transgressed. So, your mute time doubles each time you fuck up.
4. Backlinks, eg >>1, are not viewed by the robot. So "lolwut" and ">>2 lolwut" are the same post, in the eyes of the robot.
5. Gibberish at the end of a post to force originality may result in mod intervention (no BLOX posts please).
6. Images are NOT included in the filter, only text.
7. Your mute count slowly decreases over time.
8. You cannot post a picture without text.
9. Unicode is blocked. Sorry, too many exploits (Cyrillic letters, etc).
10. Posts require a certain minimum amount of original content in order to be posted.
11. Post sane, real content, well thought out replies, and mutes are unlikely.
12. The original algorithm was designed by XKCD:
http://blag.xkcd.com/2008/01/14/robot9000-and-xkcd-signal-attacking-noise-in-chat/

Hello, Anon, need some help? A shoulder to cry on? Sit down and let's have a little chat.

STEP #1, HYGIENE AND HOME:
Brush your teeth twice a day, morning and evening. Scrub'em good with all the movements you can think of, circles, up and down, lateral, front and behind. This will take somewhere around 2 minutes. Floss once a day.
Moisturize your face with a cream after washing your face in the morning.
Depending on how much you sweat shower every or every second day.
Get a haircut every 2 months. If you are balding just cut'em short, anything else looks shit and insecure about it.
If your clothes are ripped, stretched and discolored as shit, get some new ones. Basic, monotone, cheap shirts will do just fine. Again, depending on your sweat wear'em between 1 and 3 days, then change. If you got a pile of dirty rags wash it.

This brings us to your home. Doesn't matter if you live alone or with your parents, clean your dwelling once a week. Empty bottles and packages are to be thrown away immediately, instead of hoarded. It's no work if you do it this way. Used plates, glasses, etc., are to be washed off immediately after use. Again, if you do it like this, it's way less work than cleaning off a whole pile of them.
Changing bed sheets and vacuuming the place once a week.

A healthy mind lives in a clean body, living in a clean place. All that grime on yourself and around you poisons your mind. This regime gets rid of that without too much effort. You will also feel a sense of accomplishment, which boosts you for what comes next, LEAVING THE HOUSE

STEP #2, LEAVE HOUSE:
Go out every day. Do long walks of atleast 2 hours. Explore your city, your surroundings. Go into alleys you never walked before. Whenever you think, oh whats there or I never was there or anything similiat, thats where you go!
Do not ask yourself shit, like "whats the use? Enjoy the moment, do not drown out your surrounsings with your depressive thoughts.

YCYCYC

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
STEP #3, SOCIALIZE:
I want you to greet people on your walks. Not some barely audible mumble, but a clear greeting. Establish eye contact, throw'em a good day coupled with a nod or a quick wave. I want your face to glow and your voice to echoe joy when you do this. Doesnt matter if its forced and unnatural at first, its training, if it came natural to you we wouldn't have to have this conversation.

After a few weeks or months of doing everything I told you, you should feel better about yourself. You wont be chad, fucking bitches left and right and going through life constantly happy, but at leaat you wont feel absolutely miserable for once. You may be able to pull off more intense forms of socializing now.

Get into the habit of doing smalltalk with strangers, like cashiers or the people you meet on walks. It doesn't matter that it's benign and trivial shit, just do it. Observe them, what they wear, their hair, makeup, tatoos, whatever and throw them a compliment, ask them where they got it from, what meaning it holds to them. When the convo naturally found its end, say your goodbye and go on your way.

STEP #4, GET A REAL HOBBY:
You should be prepared now, physically and mentally, to go out there and take the risk of trying new stuff, which will include meeting people doing the same stuff, but you are ready for that.

Here are things I can vouche for: Bouldering/climbing, martial arts, swimming, biking, skating, going to a chess/go/shogi/mahjong/etc center where you can watch, learn and play. If you like reading, go to a library instead of doing it at home. Generally, I advise you to engage mind and body. Try several physical activities and intellectual/creative ones.

At this point it should become a self perpetuating cycle. Keep challenging yourself, keep experiencing,exploring and learning new things.
Learn to "live in the moment". Dont question the use or meaning, do not rationalize, try to let the stimuli wash over you like a river.

YCYCYC

>>72139545
not a retarded question at all.
As much as I want to geek out about the 'spiritual/religious' aspects of shrooms, it's clear that they can do wonders for mental health in an observable, material sense. I find that shrooms help me better connect my thoughts and better articulate my feelings in a more streamlined manner (on lower doses, at least).

Overall, I think they're a great tool for when you feel stagnant on your journey towards unpacking trauma/being more self-reflective. I wouldn't recommend doing them in a 'party setting.' With really close friends it's dope.

>>72139685
I'll be honest, after experiencing ego death the first time, I felt very lost and schizophrenic for a good bit, but that's because I lacked a lot of knowledge on psychedelics at the time. (this was because of LSD btw).

You'll definitely bounce back at some point if you do go a little coocoo; you kind of learn to 'pick up the pieces' in a way. If anything, I really feel like shrooms made me a bit smarter in some ways. It's a good idea to create systems for yourself that can 'ground you back to reality.' Whenever you go into your shroom experimentation, I highly recommend you drop those OCD tendencies as much as possible, as it's kind of a waste of your thinking power.

In general, I wouldn't recommend anything harder than shrooms; they're natural, you can't OD on them, and the 'spirit of the shrooms' are typically friendly (if you believe that kind of stuff)

i miss when weed was illegal.
i was a kid and it felt rebellious. having to find weird spots to smoke in without people calling the cops, getting our sesh spot trashed and having to steal from other nearby spots to build it back up, stealing milk crates from the local grocery store to add to spot as makeshift seating, blasting music off shitty walmart speakers in the middle of nowhere, lighting bonfires, having to deal with shady bartards who were looking to rob you half the time, the sheer euphoric excitement of finding someone who actually has good weed or hash, and if we were really lucky they'd have good edibles. these aren't even good things really, but god damn was it fun back then. now i'm just a fucking loser adult who walks into a dispo every month and grabs the same live resin cart and gram of RSO.

>>72148454
from www.addictionhope.com/blog/fentanyl-cause-death/

Just like other opioids, fentanyl binds to the opioid receptors in our brain, mimicking other natural opioids present in our body. Fentanyl diminishes the transmission of pain impulses in the body, inducing feelings of relaxation and euphoria.

What makes it tricky though is the fact that these opioid receptors exist in close proximity to the center of the brain that is responsible for regulating breathing. As a result, higher doses may deprive the body of the vital oxygen supply.

Prolonged lack of oxygen can ultimately result in serious brain damage, a condition known as hypoxia, and even death. Almost 90 percent of individuals who have experienced a fentanyl overdose are not likely to fully recover.

In most cases, deaths associated with a fentanyl overdose occur due to respiratory depression. Another fatal consequence of a fentanyl overdose is cardiac arrest, as the drug slows down the heart rate and lowers the blood pressure.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>72187562
phenethylamines are much more stimulating and heavy on the body high side of things. incredibly euphoric at times, and consistently euphoric from mesc analogs. other phenethylamines like 2C-B are less euphoric and more stimulating in the way LSD is stimulating but amped up a lot. hard to describe to feeling, but i associate it with a weird electric energy.
phenethylamines are sort of comparable to MDMA. most mesc analogs (including MAL) feel like candyflipping to me, but with a different more intense headspace. i remember specifically being reminded of MDA a lot from MAL, but to call it "like MDA" wouldn't be totally right either.
also i kind of lied. i said MAL feels like most other phenethylamines but things like any of the NBOMe's or most of the 2C-X compounds i would generally sooner compare to LSD than mescaline, in visuals especially.
MAL visuals are like detuned mescaline visuals, something about it is missing that makes mescaline so interesting visually, but i haven't experienced high(er) doses of MAL, only 40-60mg range so i'm not sure if i just wasn't taking enough but comparable doses of mescaline felt so much more vivid.
i really do recommend MAL though, especially if you can get it cheap. if you try MAL i wouldn't bother with other mesc analogs RCs like allyescaline or escaline because they're all the same as MAL just weaker, in my experience.

The term NPC can have many definitions.
If you mean someone who uncritically accepts and adopts mainstream tastes and views, then I suppose more women than men are NPCs, but there are definitely out-of-the-box thinking women.
If you mean a lack of consciousness or self awareness, then you can't really tell. Maybe all women are P-zombies, and only mimic real human behaviour, or maybe all other men and women are P-zombies, or maybe no one is. It's unfalsifiable.
If you mean someone who has no direction or drive in life, and lacks the ability to influence their surroundings or break free from traditional conventions and narratives, then women were more NPC in the past, but more have gained PC status over time. Then again, by this definition most people on this site are NPCs at the mercy of player character decisions.
I don't think lacking an internal monologue is indicative of NPC status, you can just think in concepts instead of thought out sentences. posts.com:
I would like if others could explain, perhaps with an example, how they experience their inferior function. The inferior is supposed to be fused together with the other functions in the unconscious.

For me, sensory stimulus is often overwhelming, since it is accompanied by a flood of other thoughts and feelings and intuitions as well. That is why I'm often uncomfortable with physical touch, or something like cuddling, and feeling another person's warmth and heartbeat, seems like it could be a bit too much. Whereas people with more differentiated sensing seem to be more dispassionate in its application.

On the other hand, I am very comfortable following the weaving threads of my intuition to whichever future they point to, but many people seem to be uncomfortable with this. Thus that usually how I comfort people; by helping them connect their past and future, or understand their meaning and place in the world.
So it seems knowing how people experience their inferior is very useful to knowing how to help and comfort them.

The INXJ door slam happens when an INXJ cuts someone out of their life - or if that's not possible, interacts with them as little as necessary from that point on! The doorslam is a form of self-defense or self-protection and is often used as a last resort! INFJs are the most (in?)famous for slamming the door, but INTJs are known to do that, too, and some believe it's a shared trait between XXFJs (which is why these people who think so call it the Fe doorslam)! The reasons behind the action vary by type: INFJs most commonly disconnect from the other person because their feelings and values were hurt by them, whereas INTJs generally slam the door because the other person is too irrational, inconsistent, dumb, and incompetent! I believe -T types are more likely to slam the door than -As are, but when the latter performs the doorslam, it's likely to be more permanent than when the former does that! ^_^;;;

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>72189929
Most people's minds are occupied and controlled by various external ideas, this is a rather universal phenomena, and MBTI is not much different in this regard. Broadly speaking is usually either to think your way out of the maze of ideas in which you are lost, or simply to stop thinking about them by force of will.

As an example of the former, you could try reading philosophy. A philosophy like Kant's, for example, is known to give a very strong defense against all other ideas, so that you don't read someone like Hegel or Jung and go insane, as many do (you might consider MBTI just a derivative form of this, even). Thus philosophy could let you uninstall or choose which brainworms you'd like to keep.

The latter is fairly self explanatory; instead of interminably trying to solve the problem you just move past it and focus on something else, until it is not longer a problem for you.

>Is your personality different how it appears in social settings?
I'm often pretty tired and dozing off at work, so I can't be as energetic as I usually am. My coworkers often see me as nice and agreeable, but very low on energy.

However, under better circumstances, I'm very outgoing and friendly. Even when I'm tired, I like to chat with people and when I get a good night's sleep, I like to go out to new places or catch up with old friends. Probably the thing that stays true both here and IRL is that people say I'm emotionally mature.

>How often do you get the wrong impression of others?
I'm good at reading people, so I rarely miss. However, when I'm wrong about someone, I'm wrong about them big time.

>How do you start your morning?
I have 30 minutes to get ready to go out. I wash my face, brush my teeth, take a warm shower, and dress in the comfiest clothes I have. I have breakfast near my office and go to work.

>>72190786
> I feel it might be nice having a gf very similar to me. Like there would be minimal need for fights or arguments ever, even though it might be more "boring"
The idea of mbti pairings is that each type complements the other through its functions and helps each other grow. Types with Ni go with Ne types, Fe goes with Fi, Se with Si, and so on. But also that the two types have enough in common to have a reason to interact. I can see MBTI seeks that point in which two types are different enough to compensate for each other's shortcomings, but similar enough that they can understand and relate to each other.

However, not everyone enters a relationship with the goal of personal growth. Some people prioritize a personal connection, they may just want to chill or have someone that relates to them. Not all INTP are inclined to have an ENTJ boss them around, and not all ISFJ want to look after an ESFP. This is why you get couples that kind of defy the usual MBTI compatibility system.

> High Compatibility
> xNTJ, ENFP

> Great Compatibility
> xSTJ, INFP

> Medium Compatibility
> xSFP, xSFJ, xNFJ

> Fair Compatibility
> xSTP, xNTP

However, remember that a lot of this is just theory, and you can find yourself having a better match with other types as well, depending on your personal circumstances.

posts.com: An American woman, Katherine Briggs, bought Jung's book and was fascinated by it. She recommended it to her married daughter, Isabel Briggs Myers, who had a degree in political science. The two of them got hooked on the idea of psychological metrics. Together they sat down and codified their own interpretation of Carl Jung, making a few important changes of their own. Jung had everyone fitting into one of four basic buckets. Myers and Briggs decided that each person probably combined elements, so they modified Jung's system and made it a little more complex, ending up with four dichotomies, like binary switches. Any combination of the four switches is allowed, and Myers and Briggs reasoned that just about every personality type could be well described by one of the sixteen possible ways for those switches to be set.

>>72191961
>but if you're sitting at home doing nothing then why not cry.
Some people can't, after so long of supressing it. Your brain starts to recognise the pattern, and so it will begin to shut down your emotions even when you're trying to feel something.
Also there's the danger that allowing that emotional wall to break will mean it won't be strong enough the next time you need it.
I experienced this myself, a month or so ago a major negative event caused my defences to break, and I cried for the first time in about a year. After that point I was crying at things that normally wouldn't be enough to push me over the edge, even just normal loneliness had me in tears. The walls have built back up now, but I can still feel they're not as strong as before.

>>72195326
Much is made of cucks these days.

At the end of the day being a sperm donor if you have healthy sperm is a perfectly noble enough thing, but I understand how genetics work. The way genetics works is that in the long term, hundreds of thousands to millions of years, all the features you think that make you "you" will disappear from the gene pool with maybe 99.99999% certainty. Only an extremely extremely small amount of humans stay in the gene pool long term because they have a mutation like say Michael Phelps where his muscles literally produce half as much lactic acid as an average person, because that's generally useful. On a long enough time horizon you either become the common ancestor of all humans or the common ancestor of none of them and the latter is far far far more likely than the former. Your seed at best is only going to result in more children and healthier children being born into a community than might otherwise happen in the short term.

Yet this is not the only way to make an impact on the world really. Imagine somebody becomes a great leader who never has kids and makes a bunch of good decisions which benefits their entire community. Through doing so every child in said community, even ones related to them, end up doing better. Such a person can have a bigger impact than a sperm donor even on their own genetic lineage (people are generally too stupid to realise that your genes aren't just in you), but they would just be written off as "cucks" or whatever by some for making other children's lives better.

For me, I want to straddle the middle between these two visions of how to leave a legacy by reproducing but being heavily involved as a provider for my children. But god damn I'm fertile and horny as shit, part of the medical history I talked about was a diagnosis of having gigantic balls, and my dick does not agree with my brain and just wants to knock up everybody around me.
